website_summaries.verdict: An excellent substitute for a full work stand when making cycle repairs in a pinch.
pros: Good for cyclists needing a sturdy, stable contact point when making repairs
Arm extends 14" from wall, giving plenty of room to work
Quick-release padded clamp prevents paint damage
2 mounting brackets, so the arm can be shifted from one location to another
cons: Base brackets can warp over time, especially with heavier bikes

customer_reviews.title: Works well but needs a quick release to rotate the jaw
customer_reviews.text: good surface to mount it. One small problem is that while the jaws have a cam lever to actuate the jaws you need an allen wrench to rotate the jaws. I have it mounted at waist height to a cabinet and rotate the jaws to clamp to the angled down tube of my bike. The clamp is placed so I can sit on a bench for work, including truing the tires and that works well. However, when I change sides on the bike I need to rotate the jaws, a bother with a wrench. An nice, easy and fairly cheap fix is to replace the bolt with a seat post quick release.
customer_reviews.author: stephenTheObdurate

customer_reviews.title: Good but fades in the sun.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the $$ it comes with two mounting plates. I mounted one outside on my deck so I can wash my bikes. The other mounting plate will eventually find its place in the garage. It could be easier to use but I find it suitable and surprisingly strong for even my heaviest fat bikes. My park tool stand is much better for service but this works well in a pinch. The rubberized tips fade quickly in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: ben Wicklund

customer_reviews.title: Wow delivered 5 days early. But when installing I ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow delivered 5 days early. But when installing I noticed a problem with the product design. Is the picture you will see a gap that gap is where it gets tightened around the orange pipe. But as you tighten it the plastic bores through from the Allen bolt and nut. Theirs no washers to prevent this from happening. This is the case with all bolts going through the plastic bracket. Also the adapter where the orange pipe connects to the plastic piece that slides on the wall bracket has no groves to prevent the pipe from spinning freely. Simple fix if the manufacturer added groves or notches to prevent uncontrolled spin.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Paul Goff

customer_reviews.title: My first bike stand- I'm happy with it as a clam :)
customer_reviews.text: I like that who plates for mounting the stand are provided (I was too lazy to read the description to find out about it). I can transport the stand to both locations where I maintain my bikes. Cleaning a bike and detailing it is so much easier with this stand. It's my 1st stand and having to go through good 30 bikes a year I appreciate the convenience of this repair stand! Gone are the days of when I'd put a bike on a my car's bicycle rack, or suspend it on 2 ropes :) Gosh, I can't believe I actually did that to myself... Thank heavens for Conquer Wall Mount Bike Repair Stand!
customer_reviews.author: Michael the II

customer_reviews.title: this great improvement to inverting it or leaning then while i ...
customer_reviews.text: i spend alot of time working over my bikes. this great improvement to inverting it or leaning then while i do that... comes with 2 mounting plates which means i can move the location between the default garage or basement location... it is fairly stable though not the highest quality of material; it will many uses. for ~$30 a pop, you can buy several of these before you pay for the entry-level versions of competitive products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome purchase for the price. I added the plate to the side of my workbench and turned it on its side so I could use it to hold the seat post of my bike. I absolutely would 100% recommend this bike clamp. It doesn't come with screws to mount the baseplate for mounting so you'll want to have your own. But is easy to install and use and makes bike maintenance super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: The clamp holds my wife's medium framed Kona mountain bike and my XL framed Specialized 29er mountain bike perfectly well. The tubular arm can rotate a little with some maintenance activities, but it's not an issue for me. If I was making a mechanical rebuild or taking the bike apart, the clamp might not be enough, but for routine maintenance after riding, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Wave addict

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: It's not perfect, but it comes with two mounting plates. I have one in my garage and one on my back fence (for bike washes or just some wrenching in the sun). Trying to adjust the angle is a little funky since it has to be done with an allen wrench instead of some sort of toggle, but for the price I can't be too picky about that. Otherwise, it's great to have and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brick

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Stand alone racks are a pain to drag around and wall mounted units are a hazard waiting to be run into. This is an excellent alternative. Bonus is the extra mounting plate (one in the shop, one in the garage). Only downside is the rotation does not fix very well so the bike will rotate if you press down on a wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Breuer

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a goid price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mount so I could set up a spot to wash my bike after hitting the trails. I screwed the plate to my deck and mount just slides in. It holds the bike fairly secure for washing and tune ups One thing to be mindful of is if you have wide handlebars, they'll hit the wall. Not a big deal but something to look out for. The package includes two wall plates so I'll mount the other to my work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Herb

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: Good stand for the price. Made of plastic, but a more durable plastic. It comes with one arm as mentioned in the review, but has 2 wall bases. The arm slides in and out of the bases easily. I use it to clean/lube/maintain my mountain bike, which has a large angle to it. I use it to hold the bike seat stem. I wouldn't recommend using it to hold a bike up permanently by the seat stem, possibly only the main frame only (horizontal bar)
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa B

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after 4 years.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for 4 years mounted on my shed in the backyard. It works easily and can hold a bike in a lot of positions. It's held a road bike, mountain bike and my daughters bikes without a problem. Very sturdy construction, I have one plate mounted on my shed wall and the other in my basement for winter maintenance. The only problem I've experienced is that the bolt that holds the arm in place has pulled through the hole (years of loosening and tightening), so I need to cut that bolt out and replace it with a wingnut/bolt combo to make turning the arm easier. I would definitely recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M Donlin

customer_reviews.title: Works well, inside and outside
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to make it easier to clean my bike. I mounted the bracket on a pole in my back yard. Now, I can mount my bike off the ground at eye level to clean or maintain my bike outside near my garden hose. No more messy garage floor from cleaning and oiling the chain etc. A bonus is a second mounting bracket so I can mount my bike in the garage off the floor for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: LD Smith

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it appears to be a quality product at a good price. The inclusion of two mounting brackets and ...
customer_reviews.text: Where the clamp part attaches to the pipe needs to be stronger, it cannot be tightened enough to keep the bike stable. I put a stool under the front wheel to help. Otherwise it appears to be a quality product at a good price. The inclusion of two mounting brackets and the one allen wrench were nice touches.
customer_reviews.author: visionfounder

customer_reviews.title: this is a great bargain. As others have mentioned
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the ~$150 most bike stands cost, this is a great bargain. As others have mentioned, it comes with two mounting brackets. I have one mounted on the wall, and I'm saving the other one to make a standing mount out 2x4's for a fraction of the price of a retail bike stand. It sits in your garage, so who cares how it looks? It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Great for space conservation
customer_reviews.text: Mounts easily holds bike well, easily positioned. Comes off easily and stores out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: This has worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great for me. I took the suggestion of another poster and placed it at a height that allows the front wheel of my mountain to rest on the floor while the rear wheel is raised up. This allows me to work and clean the drivetrain. My road bike is much lighter and is easily held with both wheels off the ground . Price was good on this unit and so far it has been a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. Giloy

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a decent bike holder
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Built a special support for it to better fit my bench and bikes but that's not necessary if you have the room. Very secure in the horizontal position but might move a bit as the bike is rotated unless you really crank down on the screws holding the clamp to the rod. Like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: vickanid@hotmail.com

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for my 35 lb. mountain bike. It’s nice that they give you an extra wall hanger so that you can use the bracket in a second location.
customer_reviews.author: Whitefang

customer_reviews.title: Missing large Nut/Bolt set.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a missing large Nut/Bolt set. Looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: FRANCOIS A.

customer_reviews.title: Poor mans alternative to the $200 bike stand
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive alternative to the $200. bike stands that take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: A. Guerra

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for working on your bike with limited space. The mounting plate remains attached to the wall so you can easily slide the clamping arm onto the plate or remove it. Clamp holds well and accommodates cables as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: The trnasport and the ship are grate. I use to clean and fixe my bike, and for anything that i can do for may bike. The mount it’s easy and you can quit and put anytime.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rincón Villate

customer_reviews.title: Simple quality product that works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. Makes routine maintenance and tire repair much easier. Quality construction. The two wall plates is a great idea. I have one mount on patio for working on bike and one mounted off patio for washing. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: rod jones

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Can install the bracket and use in multiple locations. Easily holds up a bike.
customer_reviews.author: ray J

customer_reviews.title: Great Option
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to install on the back door of my Sprinter van. Wish I had a photo. Works great. Am able to work on my bike anywhere I have my van!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bock

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Product...No frills.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a gem for a fraction of the cost. I can mount the hanging plate on my fence and disconnect the clamp so it stays in perfect condition. Just slides out in two seconds. I like that they give you two mounting plates too.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest, I wasn't expecting very much due to the price. But was pleasantly surprised when I received this. I have only used it a handful of times, but it works great! Seems to be made pretty well and comes with 2 of the wall mount brackets. Great addition to my garage.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this repair stand/clamp for the price. Build quality is good, but plastic, so it's not as stiff as you would get from an all-steel mount, but all things considered, it's a steal. I can buy 3 or more of these for the price of the blue brand's cheapest wall-mount model.
customer_reviews.author: Dane B.

customer_reviews.title: Bike repair stand.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bicycle holder,you need a post in the ground to mount it though or you could mount it on a wall if you like,plus you get 2 mounting sleeves with it,I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Oglethorpe

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works good. The orange grippers fall out easy. Maybe will superglue.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Born

customer_reviews.title: How Often do you buy something that is so much better than expected?
customer_reviews.text: How Often do you buy something that is so much better than expected? For $30 I expected OK...maybe on the hi end of OK. This stand is GREAT. Well worth the money; I will buy a second one just to have in another location! Another nice feature is the 2nd mounting plate; I did not expect that at all. Very good stuff
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Works great! It comes with two mounting brackets which work ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It comes with two mounting brackets which work wonderfully for me. I mounted both to an 8 ft board and use one mounting point for repairs and maintenance and the other to store my bike high and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.text: keeps moving on the wall. never stayed still for me to work on bike. returned.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I've only used it twice and it's better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it twice and it's better than expected. The clamps clamp tight and holds my bike, it's a fairly heavy mountain bike. Plenty of distance between pedals and wall. It is good for those that don't have much space. Slips out of the wall bracket easily so it won't be in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Arrowflicker

customer_reviews.title: seems fine
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it enough but it is quite rugged not sure how the plastic bar clamp will stand up but I'm jout using for my wifes' bike and my so not really a problem for me
customer_reviews.author: earl s nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you have a place to put this, you should absolutely buy this over the other stands for your house. It's easy to install and keeps everything in place while you're working on your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bike Stand!
customer_reviews.text: This bike stand is awesome. For the money you will be hard pressed to find a better value. It comes with two wall brackets so you can mount one high and one low. This allows you to store the stand up high out of head-knocker range when not in use, or just have two locations to mount it. The stand is as stable as it needs to be, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J Linscott

customer_reviews.title: quality but it seems sturdy enough. Doing some more work this weekend so ...
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this clamp last night and did some brake work + cleaning on my Giant Glory Downhill bike. I was skeptical about the price vs. quality but it seems sturdy enough. Doing some more work this weekend so we'll see how it hold up. Id say if you're using it for a light road bike you can go wrong. My DH bike is wayyyyy heavier than anything meant for road riding, so i'd recommend for all you road riders, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: paul plaza

customer_reviews.title: Perfedt for ocasional use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my limited use, great price compared with "professional" versions.
customer_reviews.author: Gearhead

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product easy to use easy to move very nice
customer_reviews.author: michael Thomas thrasher

customer_reviews.title: bad quality product
customer_reviews.text: The product plastic base attached to the triangular metal screwed to the way broke, I need to get a refund, bad quality product, the bicycle is standard size and weight, how can we channel this request. I am glad I detected it before it broke, the bicycle is above my car. regards Arfilio
customer_reviews.author: Arfilio M.

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty convenient way to occassionaly work on my bike. The collar isn't strong enough to hold the entire bike perpendicular so I use it to lift the rear wheel to work on the chain and cassette.
customer_reviews.author: K. McKenna

customer_reviews.title: May not be a professional ParkTool repair stand but worked great while servicing a lighter and heavier bike
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! May not be a professional ParkTool repair stand but worked great while servicing a lighter and heavier bike. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Noffke

customer_reviews.title: Simple and strong.
customer_reviews.text: This is simple and takes little room. Works great and has two mounts so you can put one outside to wash your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wilson

customer_reviews.title: A hard to beat value
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Solid construction; the clamp and mechanism are both very sturdy - Comes off the wall when not in use - Wow, that price is low. Cons: - If you don't balance the weight of the bike in the clamp, the arm may rotate until gravity achieves the balance itself, no matter how tight the bolts are. For this reason, I have given this workstand only 4 stars. Other notes: - The base is 5 inches wide, and 6 inches tall. - The bolts holding the arm can be loosened to rotate the arm. It comes with the proper size hex keys with which to make these adjustments, but they are standard sizes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Loeb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I ordered, saves space, not only for repairing bikes but for display or storage
customer_reviews.author: RICK THE BIKEMAN

customer_reviews.title: works well, space saver
customer_reviews.text: great idea. It works well bu tmake sure you mount it on sturdy wood or it will bend. Makes it much easier to work on bike doing small repairs
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy at all ok for small stuff like headset but crank and wheels not so much
customer_reviews.author: Videeo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy! It can carry 50lb bike easy. Just make sure you screw the plate good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike maintenance stand
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mount for cleaning my mountain bike. Well designed, strong.
customer_reviews.author: Clemdog

customer_reviews.title: Works as it Should.
customer_reviews.text: Comes with 2 cleats. I mounted one high and one lower. It's hi-impact plastic that can handle abuse. I over-tightened and dented the frame on my GFs aluminum bike. No fear in the clamp unit breaking. The support strut is steel tubing and is strong. For storage I pull the unit off the wall and clamp it to a water line. This eliminates the possibility of striking my head on it.
customer_reviews.author: Hiroku-hiroku

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great item to have when working on bikes. Makes life so much easier and enjoyable !!
customer_reviews.author: peter m honey

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: When you need this item this one works well. Fast delivery, stable construction and all parts included.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: A nice bracket that didn't fit my bike.
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of this bracket, and I think that it is very well made considering the price. So I was sad to discover that it won't fit my bike. My bike has a large frame tube (65 MM) I carefully measured before ordering, and noted that the description claims that it fits up to a 75 MM tube. Further, because of the unarticulated design of the jaws, they don't remain parallel at wide openings, so won't properly grip a wide tube. In short, even with the jaw wide-open, it simply doesn't fit my bike because the clamp doesn't match it's advertised specifications. So I reluctantly returned it.
customer_reviews.author: V. Simon

customer_reviews.title: Okay bike stand
customer_reviews.text: It is a good deal for the price, but I don't think this is even close to the quality of a Park tool bike stand.
customer_reviews.author: Claudio and Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome, and came with two mounting brackets so I ...
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome, and came with two mounting brackets so I can move it around with easy! Easily detachable to stow.
customer_reviews.author: David Deckert

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for hanging up a bike to clean of store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my cross bike but it strains with my 29r. Overall this is a great contraption for basic wrenching.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This mount is sturdy. Many people complain it twists/slides when adjusted to hold bike perpendicular to the ground by the seat post, mainly because there bike is probably to heavy, but a quick fix is to slide a 3m backed sand paper facing out to prevent sliding. It holds my bike perfect! My mtb is <30 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Baker

customer_reviews.title: This turned out to be what I needed. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be what I needed. I mounted the brackets onto 6x6" treated posts. Now, working on bikes has become manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Lee Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice clamp that makes bike repairs so much easier
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice clamp that makes bike repairs so much easier. It's not the best repair stand by any means but the value for the money is good.
customer_reviews.author: PADFOOT

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My first bike stand is solid and versatile enough to make most jobs easier.
customer_reviews.author: Worthme

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and easily clamps onto all sizes of bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M. Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike wall bracket
customer_reviews.text: I like ke it, it works, it is not perfect but it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Michael ovalle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: have to have it if you do ANYTHING with your bike. All my friends want one!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Bruening

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, great price
customer_reviews.text: simple, sturdy, great price. used it once so far and I was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy descarpentrie

customer_reviews.title: Definitely doesn't seem like it would hold up to heavy use
customer_reviews.text: It's on the cheaper end and you definitely get what you pay for but for the home user who wants to occasionally clean your chain or other light use it is ok. Definitely doesn't seem like it would hold up to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: PilotPeat

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but make sure it is tight.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well but has trouble securely gripping the bike frame. I'm concerned that by cranking it down very tight, it will eventually break. Stickier rubber in the gripping area might help.
customer_reviews.author: Workplace S.

customer_reviews.title: effective, durable, attractive, simple, easily portable and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I have used many bike stands over the years, both as a pro mechanic and for home use on my fleet of bikes. I do have a larger stand that I use in my garage. This one I got to mount to the rear door in my van to use trail-side and on extended bike trips. It is effective, durable, attractive, simple, easily portable and inexpensive; all that is needed for the brief periods of time I will need it. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Craig M Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A bit longer would have been better . . .
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: no too much tight when you hook your frame.. but, its ok for the price..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Too flimsy to hold heavier cruiser type beach bikes . If you have a lighter weight aluminum or carbon fiber bike this might be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Adam  F

customer_reviews.title: cheap and bike rotates
customer_reviews.text: cheap and wont hold very well, spend the money and get a good one
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little on the light side but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very solid. I was impressed with the size of the plates, in a good way!!
customer_reviews.text: It is good if you just want to clamp the frame but if you want to hold the bike from the seat post you gotta tight it more bc it will try to find a balance position. I don’t want to right it too much to avoid loosing the screws or nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Conquer Wall Mount Bike Repair Stand Bicycle Mechanic Workstand
feature_bullets: The ultimate space saving repair stand
Designed to easily mount to any post or wall stud - arm extends 14" from wall
Clamp allows for clamping of tubes from 30mm to 75mm
Sturdy steel construction, mounting flange has 5 holes (hardware not included)
Clamp arm quickly detaches when not in use

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
